<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	We may be affected by climate change and market or regulatory responses to climate change.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Climate change, including the impact of global warming, could have a material adverse effect on our results of operations, financial condition, and liquidity if it were to disrupt the demand, supply or delivery of product, management of our business, or result in cost increases as a result of government regulation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Security breaches and other disruptions could compromise our information and expose us to liability, which would cause our business and reputation to suffer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:COURIER NEW;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	In the ordinary course of our business, we store sensitive data, including intellectual property, our proprietary business information, certain information regarding our business partners, and personally identifiable information of our employees, in our computer networks. The secure maintenance and transmission of this information is critical to our operations and reputation.&nbsp;Despite our security measures, our information technology and infrastructure may be vulnerable to attacks by hackers or breached due to employee error, malfeasance or other disruptions. Although we have not been adversely affected in any significant manner, we have experienced problems with information security in the past which we believe is primarily due to breaches of security by current or former employees gaining access to restricted information. Any such breach could compromise our computer networks and the information stored there could be accessed, publicly disclosed, lost or stolen. Although we have purchased cyber liability insurance, any such access, disclosure or other loss of information could result in legal claims or proceedings, liability under laws that protect the privacy of personal information, and regulatory penalties, and damage our reputation, any of which could adversely affect our business and competitive position.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT 55.45PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.45PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 34PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<A NAME="SCLN-20151231X10K_HTM_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Legal Proceedings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	As previously disclosed, since 2010 the SEC and the DOJ ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	each been conducting formal investigations of us regarding a range of matters, including the possibility of violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (&#x201C;FCPA&#x201D;), primarily related to certain historical sales and marketing activities with respect to our China operations. In response to these matters, our Board appointed a Special Committee of independent directors (the &#x201C;Special Committee&#x201D;) to oversee our response to the government inquiry. Based on an initial review, the Special Committee decided to undertake an independent investigation as to matters reflected in and arising from the SEC and DOJ investigations in order to evaluate whether any violation of the FCPA or other laws occurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	As previously disclosed, we entered into a settlement agreement with the SEC that fully resolved the SEC&#x2019;s investigation. Under the terms of the settlement agreement, we paid a total of $12.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	in February 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	disgorgement, pre-judgment interest and a penalty.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;">
	The payment is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	in line with the charges we previously recorded and disclosed in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	Form 10-Q filed with the SEC on August 10, 2015. As part of the agreement, we neither admitted nor denied engagement in any wrongdoing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and we agreed to give status reports to the SEC for the next three years on our continued remediation and implementation of anti-corruption compliance measures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA;COLOR:#000000;">
	. The DOJ has also completed its related investigation and has declined to pursue any action.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As previously disclosed, we have taken, and continue to take certain steps to enhance our existing anti-bribery compliance efforts, including (i) evaluating and expanding our training of employees regarding understanding and compliance with laws including the FCPA and other anti-bribery laws and regulations, (ii) evaluating existing compliance and anti-bribery policies and guidelines and preparing new, more detailed policies and guidelines for implementation after review by our Board of Directors and/or committees of the Board of Directors, (iii) implementing a pre-approval policy for certain expenses including payments for, or reimbursement of, travel and entertainment expenses, and sponsorships of certain third-party events, (iv) establishing an automated system for recording and approving travel a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	nd entertainment expenditures,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and (v) hiring a Vice President of Compliance and an Internal Audit Director to monitor and enforce compliance with our policies. Also, upon the recommendation of the Special Committee, the Audit Committee of
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the Board has retained a third-party consultant to observe and make recommendations regarding our FCPA compliance. We will continue to emphasize the importance of compliance and ethical business conduct.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NovaMed was a party to a Distribution and Supply Agreement with MEDA originally entered into in 2007. Following our acquisition of NovaMed in 2011, MEDA claimed it had a right to terminate the agreement under a change of control provision. NovaMed does not believe that MEDA had a right of termination under the agreement. NovaMed filed an application for binding arbitration with the China International Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission (&#x201C;CIETAC&#x201D;) on July 26, 2012. On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 2014, CIETAC issued the final Award of the Arbitral Tribunal. The Arbitral Tribunal found that MEDA did have a right to terminate the agreement upon a change of control, but that MEDA must make reasonable reimbursement to NovaMed before any product rights are returned to MEDA. The amount that must be paid includes $333,333 as &#x201C;unjust enrichment&#x201D; plus an amount for reasonable compensation for such services provided by NovaMed to MEDA. The amount of such payment for services was not determined by the Arbitral Tribunal, but was left to be determined by NovaMed. On April 30, 2014, NovaMed informed MEDA that its determination of reasonable compensation for its services was $3,314,629, including the $333,333 for unjust enrichment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	MEDA made a counter offer and the parties were attempting to resolve the matter without an additional arbitration proceeding. In December 2014, NovaMed filed a &#x201C;Request for Second Arbitration&#x201D; with CIETAC in order to enforce its right to compensation. The arbitration case is pending with CIETAC and no hearing has taken place yet. The amount of any final payment to NovaMed remains uncertain, and as such the Company has not recognized it as a gain contingency.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:36.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:01.22%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0.05PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;

	We recorded a charge of $2.0 million for 2013 related to the possibility of a settlement, and recorded an additional charge of $10.8 million associated with the SEC settlement for 2015. Refer to

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	During fiscal 2012, we identified an impairment indicator with respect to our intangible assets related to our promotion and distribution contract rights and recorded losses of approximately $42.7 million to recognize the full impairment. We recorded a benefit for income tax of approximately $6.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2012 due to the impairment of intangible assets, which resulted in a reversal of deferred tax liabilities. This was partially offset by the impact of recognizing a full valuation allowance on any remaining NovaMed deferred tax assets. In addition, we recorded a non-cash gain of $15.4 million related to the contingent consideration because revenue and EBITDA targets of NovaMed were not achieved.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(3)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	On April 18, 2011, we acquired NovaMed Pharmaceuticals, Inc. ("NovaMed") for approximately $24.6 million in cash and 8,298,110 shares of SciClone common stock and a contingent right to receive additional cash consideration (&#x201C;the contingent consideration&#x201D;) of up to $43.0 million based upon achievement of revenue and earnings targets for the 2011 and 2012 fiscal years. Commencing April 18, 2011, the Company&#x2019;s financial statements include the assets, liabilities, and operating results of NovaMed.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 6PT 55.45PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.45PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 6PT 55.45PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.45PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item&nbsp;7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 34PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<A NAME="SCLN-20151231X10K_HTM_MANAGEMENT_DISCUSSION">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	This Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations should be read in conjunction with the &#x201C;Selected Financial Data&#x201D; and our consolidated financial statements and related notes thereto included elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form 10-K. This Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations and other parts of this Annual Report on Form 10-K contain forward-looking statements which involve risks and uncertainties. See &#x201C;Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements&#x201D; and &#x201C;Risk Factors&#x201D; contained in this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	SciClone Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCLN) is a United States (&#x201C;US&#x201D;)-headquartered, China-focused, specialty pharmaceutical company with a substantial commercial business and a product portfolio of therapies for oncology, infectious diseases and cardiovascular disorders. We are focused on continuing to grow our revenue and profitability. Our business and corporate strategy is focused primarily on the People&#x2019;s Republic of China (&#x201C;China&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or &#x201C;PRC&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	) where we have built a solid reputation and established a strong brand through many years of experience marketing our lead product, ZADAXIN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(thymalfasin). In addition, we have an established product promotion business model with large pharmaceutical partners and we are focused on establishing profitability in all of these collaborations. We believe our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	sales and marketing strengths position us to benefit from the long-term expansion of the pharmaceutical market in China.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	e Chinese
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pharmaceutical market currently ranks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	second
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	among the global pharmaceutical markets, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	had an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	estimated worth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$105 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. It is forecasted to increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	significantly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to $200 billion by 2020.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We seek
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to expand our presence in China and increase revenues by growing sales and profits of our current product portfolio, launching new products from our development pipeline, adding new, profitable product services agreements and leveraging our strong cash position to in-license additional products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We operate in two segments which are generally based on the nature and location of our customers: 1) China and 2) the Rest of the World, which includes our US and Hong Kong operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have two categories of revenues: &#x201C;product sales revenues&#x201D; and &#x201C;promotion services revenues.&#x201D; Our product sales revenues result from our proprietary and in-licensed products, including our lead product, ZADAXIN; DC Bead
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a product for the embolization of malignant hypervascularized tumors, for which we initiated sales and recorded product revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	beginning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in the third quarter of 2015, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	products from Pfizer International Trading (Shanghai) Ltd. (&#x201C;Pfizer&#x201D;). Through June 30, 2015, our product sales revenues also included Aggrastat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, an intervention cardiology product launched in China in 2009, in-licensed from Cardiome Pharma Corp (&#x201C;Cardiome&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In August 2015, we and Cardiome mutually agreed to end our collaboration for Aggrastat, thereby terminating our exclusive distribution rights in China, and return
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	all rights to the product to Cardiome
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. We recorded Aggrastat revenues of $1.8 million, $1.1 million and $0 million for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively, and we do not expect to generate any further Aggrastat revenues. We do not anticipate that the termination of this agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	will adversely affect our profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	ZADAXIN has the highest margins in our portfolio as it is a premium product sold exclusively by SciClone. In addition, we anticipate that new marketed products, when and if introduced, can increase the future revenues and profitability of our pharmaceutical business in China over the coming years. Our &#x201C;promotion&nbsp;services revenues&#x201D; result primarily from fees we receive for exclusively promoting products in China for Baxter International, Inc. (&#x201C;Baxter&#x201D;). We recognize promotion services revenues as a percentage of our collaborators&#x2019; product sales revenue for these exclusively promoted products.&nbsp;Over time, as additional proprietary or in-licensed products come to the market, we aim to shift our product mix towards those products providing higher margins for us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ZADAXIN is approved in over 30 countries and may be used for the treatment of HBV, HCV, and certain ca
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ncers, and as a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	n
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	immune
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	system
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	enhancer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	according to the local regulatory approvals we have in these countries. In China, thymalfasin is included in the treatment guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health (&#x201C;MOH&#x201D;) for liver cancer, as well as guidelines for treatment of chronic HBV (issued by both the Chinese Medical Association and the Asian-Pacific Association for the Study of the Liver) and invasive fungal infections of critically ill patients (issued by the Chinese Medical Association). Our sales force is focused on increasing sales to the country&#x2019;s largest hospitals (class 3A with over 500 beds) as well as mid-size hospitals (class 2A). These hospitals serve Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities located mostly in the eastern part of China,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	which are the largest and generally have the most affluent populations. We are widening our market strategies by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	piloting e-commerce approaches to reach customers.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We are also seeking to expand the indications for which ZADAXIN could be used, including sepsis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We initiated sales and recorded our first product revenue from DC Bead in the third quarter of fiscal 2015. The China Food and Drug Administration had approved the registration of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DC Bead
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the embolization of malignant hypervascularized tumors in August 2014. DC Bead may be used to treat liver cancer, a large and growing indication in China, and we believe our oncology sales team and academic marketing liaisons have established high quality relationships with medical professionals and institutions that specialize in cancer treatment, which we believe will be a valuable asset as we continue commercial sales of DC Bead. BioCompatibles UK Ltd. (&#x201C;BTG&#x201D;) and SciClone previously entered into an agreement granting SciClone exclusive licensing and distribution rights to DC Bead in China. Under the agreement, we are purchasing DC Bead product from BTG.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are also pursuing the registration of several other therapeutic products in China. These include: Loramyc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, a mucoadhesive tablet formulation of miconazole lauriad to treat oropharyngeal candidiasis; and RapidFilm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, an oral film formulation of ondansetron to treat nausea induced by chemotherapy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our agreement with Baxter is for a 5-year term, through December 2017, and our agreement with Pfizer is for a 5-year term, through June 2019. We are pursuing additional agreements to generate additional revenue. We continue to seek in-licensing arrangements for well-differentiated products at various stages of development that, if not yet approved, have a defined regulatory approval pathway in China. Our objective is to in-license products that provide us with higher margins, augmenting our product sales revenue and profitability, and we continue to explore opportunities to optimize our promotion services revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2015, Theravance Biopharma, Inc. (&#x201C;Theravance Biopharma&#x201D;) granted SciClone exclusive development and commercialization rights to VIBATIV
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(telavancin) in China, as well as the Hong Kong SAR, the Macau SAR, Taiwan and Vietnam, in exchange for upfront and regulatory milestone payments totaling $6 million. SciClone will be responsible for all aspects of development and commercialization in the partnered regions, including pre- and post-launch activities and product registration. SciClone will initially develop VIBATIV for hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia and ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia, and additional indications may include complicated skin and skin structure infections and potentially bacteremia. Theravance Biopharma will sell to SciClone all clinical and commercial product required to develop and commercialize VIBATIV in China and our other licensed territories.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In December 2014, we entered into a strategic partnership with The Medicines Company for two cardiovascular products in China. The partnership includes an agreement granting us a license and the exclusive rights in China to promote two products including 1) Angiomax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(bivalirudin) for Injection, an anticoagulant indicated in patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) with provisional use of glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor (GPI) and in patients with, or at risk of, heparin-induced thrombocytopenia and thrombosis syndrome undergoing PCI for which a Phase 3 registration trial was completed in China and is currently under review by the China Food and Drug Administration for marketing approval, and 2) Cleviprex
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(clevidipine) Injectable Emulsion, a third-generation dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker indicated for the reduction of blood pressure when oral therapy is not feasible or desirable for which a clinical trial application (CTA) for China was filed in 2013.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We received CTA approval from the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	China Food and Drug Administration (&#x201C;CFDA&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in early 2016 and are preparing a clinical study.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Under the terms of the agreement, we will be responsible for all aspects of commercialization, including pre-and post-launch activities, for both products in the China market (excluding Hong Kong and Macao). We have also agreed to participate in the China registration process for both products. Financial terms of the agreement, in addition to net sales royalties payable to The Medicines Company, include the following additional payments to The Medicines Company: an upfront payment made in the fourth quarter of 2014; a project support services fee; and regulatory/commercial success milestone payments of up to an aggregate of $50.5 million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In June 2013, we entered into a license agreement with Taiwan Liposome Company (&#x201C;TLC&#x201D;) which granted us a license and the exclusive rights in China, Hong Kong and Macao to promote, market, distribute and sell ProFlow
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for the treatment of peripheral arterial disease (&#x201C;PAD&#x201D;) and other indications. PAD is a serious cardiovascular condition in which blood flow to the limbs (usually the legs) is restricted due to arterial plaque build-up. Under the terms of the agreement, TLC will be responsible for the continued development including potential clinical trials and regulatory activities, as well as the manufacture and supply of ProFlow, and we will be responsible for all aspects of commercialization including pre-and post-launch activities. The agreement provides for the principal terms of the arrangement between SciClone and TLC, and in March 2014, the companies entered into a supplemental collaboration and license agreement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In November 2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	TLC was notified by the CFDA that ProFlow did not receive clinical trial approval and TLC is in the process of appealing the decision.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2013, we entered into a framework agreement with Zensun (Shanghai) Science &amp; Technology Co., Ltd. (&#x201C;Zensun&#x201D;) for the exclusive promotion, marketing, distribution and sale of Neucardin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	TM
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in China, Hong Kong and Macao. Neucardin is a novel,
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	first-in-class therapeutic for the treatment of patients with intermediate to advanced heart failure, for which a New Drug Application (&#x201C;NDA&#x201D;) was submitted to and accepted for review by the CFDA in 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In December 2013, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he CFDA informed Zensun that its Phase 2 data is insufficient, and has asked Zensun to submit a new NDA once the ongoing Phase 3 study reached its endpoints.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As part of our agreement with Zensun, we agreed to loan up to $12 million to Zensun, of which $12 million had been loaned as of December 31, 2015 (refer to Note 6 to the consolidated financial statements appearing under
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Part II, Item 8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for further information regarding the Zensun loans).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we recognized $7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, $11 million and $5.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively, in research and development expenses related to our in-license arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Recent governmental policy changes in China have eliminated national regulation of the maximum retail drug prices for most drugs effective as of June 1, 2015.&nbsp;Decisions by provincial authorities appear to be emerging as the primary governmental mechanism for price controls.&nbsp;As an example, the Zhejiang provincial authority announced a price limitation for sales of ZADAXIN in the province in April 2015 that became effective in May 2015.&nbsp;We were able to mitigate the impact of this price limitation by shifting an equitable portion of the burden of the price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reduction to our distributor in our sales channel; accordingly, the impact of the price reduction through the year ended December 31, 2015 was $2.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8 million. We anticipate that provincial pricing decisions will continue to be a significant factor in the China pharmaceutical market for the foreseeable future. The impact of such decisions on our future results is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	unpredictable, but we expect that pricing pressures on revenue in 2016 will be offset at least in significant part through sharing of the burden with our China distributor and potentially thr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ough volume increases.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	However, in the future, prices could be reduced to levels significantly below those that would prevail in an unregulated market, which may limit the growth of our revenues or cause them to decline.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our new contractual arrangement with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sinopharm Holding Lingyun Biopharmaceutical (Shanghai) Co. Ltd (Sinopharm), our China distributor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or ZADAXIN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which commenced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	January 1, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will result
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	later recognition (relative to practices prevailing through December 31, 2015) of a portion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenue invoiced to Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	situations where the provincial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tender price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is greater
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	relative to a referenced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(baseline) tender
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	price.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	This is due to a mechanism in the new contractual arrangement whereby the customer is invoiced at a lower base price relative to that prevailing in the previous agreement. The lower base price (as well as estimated price compensation payable due to the distributor for situations where the provincial tender price is lower than the referenced (baseline) tender price) will be recorded as revenue after the sale is completed. The distributor will then be invoiced for the portion of the price that may result from situations where the provincial tender price is greater than the referenced (baseline) tender price at a later time, and such amount will be recognized as revenue after the amount has been agreed to with the distributor.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Al
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	though we do not expect this new arrangement to have a significant impact on annual revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or the amount recognized on an annual basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, it may impact quarterly revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	amounts and timing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, especially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As previously disclosed, since 2010 the US Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;) and the US Department of Justice (&#x201C;DOJ&#x201D;) had each been conducting formal investigations of us regarding a range of matters, including the possibility of violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (&#x201C;FCPA&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On February 4, 2016, we announced that we have entered into a settlement agreement with the SEC fully resolving the SEC&#x2019;s investigation into possible violations of the FCPA. Under the terms of the settlement agreement, in February
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016 we paid a total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $12.8 million, including disgorgement, pre-judgment interest and a penalty as final settlement which was released from our restricted escrow account which we funded in the fourth quarter of 2015. This payment is in line with the charges we previously recorded and disclosed in our Form 10-Q filed with the SEC on August 10, 2015. As part of the agreement we neither admitted nor denied engagement in any wrongdoing and we agreed to give status reports to the SEC for the next three years on our continued remediation and implementation of anti-corruption compliance measures. The DOJ has also completed its related investigation and has declined to pursue any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	action (refer to Notes 18 and 22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the consolidated financial statements appearing under Part II, Item 8 and &#x201C;Legal Proceedings&#x201D; in Part I, Item 3 for further information regarding the SEC and DOJ investigations).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We believe our cash and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and ongoing revenue generating business operations will be sufficient to support our current operating plan for at least the next 12 months. Our results may fluctuate from quarter to quarter and we may report losses in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	42
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:09.70%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.56%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:06.98%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.50PT;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Product sales were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	154.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$132.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $99.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	22.4 million, or 17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, was primarily attributable to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in ZADAXIN unit sales and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stronger
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	demand for certain oncology products
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. ZADAXIN sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	146.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$126.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the prior year, an increase of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or 16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mainly relat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ed to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% increase in volume sold, offset partially by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% decrease in selling price mainly related to a decrease in the list price of ZADAXIN in the Zhejiang province since May 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Product sales for the year ended December 31, 2015, also included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Pfizer product sales and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	l immaterial DC Bead revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in product sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $32.6 million, or 33%, for the year ended December 31, 2014 compared to 2013, was primarily attributable to an increase in ZAD
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	AXIN unit sales and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stronger
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	demand for certain oncology products
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. ZADAXIN sales were $126.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to $96.3 million for the prior year, an increase of $29.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or 31%, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mainly related to an increase in volume sold, and to a lesser extent related to an increase in selling price. We believe our ZADAXIN product revenues in the first half of fiscal 2013 were adversely affected by the increase in channel inventory we experienced in the third quarter of 2012. We believe channel inventory for ZADAXIN ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s returned to normalized levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We anticipate that ZADAXIN revenues in 2016 will be higher than 2015, although
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our revenues are subject to exchange rate fluctuations and provincial adjustments to tender
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(retail level, government approved)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	prices which we cannot predict
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The majority of our sales have been in US dollars, although a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	portion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of our s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ales are denominated in RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Per our previous contractual arrangement with Sinopharm through December 31, 2015, and a renewed contractual arrangement with Sinopharm (our sole
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	importer and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	distributor for ZADAXIN in China) which took effect January 1, 2016, our sales of ZADAXIN to Sinopharm have been and continue to be denominated in US dollars. However, the established importer price may be adjusted quarterly based upon exchange rate fluctuations between the US dollar and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	RMB.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	China ZADAXIN sales revenues are subject to exchange rate risk, and in recent months the RMB has experienced devaluation. In addition, per our previous contractual arrangement with Sinopharm during the year ended December 31, 2015, and a renewed contractual arrange
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ment with Sinopharm which took e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ffect January 1, 2016, our contracted sales prices to Sinopharm are subject to adjustment based on changes in tender prices within the province territories
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our new contractual arrangement with Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which commenced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	January 1, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will result
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	later recognition (relative to practices prevailing through December 31, 2015) of a portion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenue invoiced to Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	situations where the provincial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tender price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is greater
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	relative to a referenced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(baseline) tender
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	This is due to a mechanism in the new contractual arrangement whereby the customer is invoiced at a lower base price relative to that prevailing in the previous agreement. The lower base price (as well as estimated price compensation payable due to the distributor for situations where the provincial tender price is lower than the referenced (baseline) tender price) will be recorded as revenue after the sale is completed. The distributor will then be invoiced for the portion of the price that may result from situations where the provincial tender price is greater than the referenced (baseline) tender price at a later time, and such amount will be recognized as revenue after the amount has been agreed to with the distributor.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Although we do not expect this new arrangement to have a significant impact on annual revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or the amount recognized on an annual basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, it may impact quarterly revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	amounts and timing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, especially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Recent governmental policy changes in China have eliminated national regulation of the maximum retail drug prices for most drugs effective as of June 1, 2015.&nbsp;Decisions by provincial authorities appear to be emerging as the primary governmental mechanism for price controls.&nbsp;As an example, the Zhejiang provincial authority announced a price limitation for sales of ZADAXIN in the province in April 2015 that became effective in May 2015.&nbsp;Changes in provincial drug prices for ZADAXIN in the provinces could impact our future sales revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	China, pharmaceutical products are imported and distributed through a tiered method of distribution. For our proprietary product ZADAXIN, we manufacture our product using our US and European contract manufacturers, and we generate our product sales revenue through sales of ZADAXIN product to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Sinopharm act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as an importer, and also as the top &#x201C;tier&#x201D; of the distribution system (&#x201C;Tier 1&#x201D;) in China. Our ZADAXIN sales occur when Sinopharm purchases product from us without any right of return except for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	replacement of product in the event of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	damaged product or quality control issues. Passage of title and risk of loss are transferred to Sinopharm at the time of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	arrival of a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at its destination
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. After the sale, Sinopharm clears products through China import customs, sells directly to large hospitals and holds additional product it has purchased in inventory for sale to the next tier in the distribution system. The second-tier (&#x201C;Tier 2&#x201D;) distributors are responsible for the further sale and distribution of the products they purchase from the importer, either through sales of product directly to the retail level (hospitals and pharmacies), or to third-tier (&#x201C;Tier 3&#x201D;) local or regional distributors who, in turn, sell products to hospitals and pharmacies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Promotion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	services revenue was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	27.6 million for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and related to products promoted under agreements with Baxter and Sanofi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Aventis S.A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;Sanofi&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Promotion services revenue increased $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.1 million or 4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to 2014, related to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an increase in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Endoxan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	TM
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(Baxter)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	product sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Promotion services revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decreased $24.8 million or 90% for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expiration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of our promotion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	al
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	agreements with Sanofi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of December 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our promotion agreements with Sanofi, consisting of individual promotional agreements for certain pharmaceutical products and supplementary agreements extending the terms thereof, were not renewed and expired on December 31, 2013. NovaMed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Pharmaceuticals (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Shanghai
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) Co. Ltd. (&#x201C;NovaMed Shanghai&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and Sanofi negotiated a settlement of certain amounts in dispute, effective as of July 14, 2014, and NovaMed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Shanghai
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	received approximately 22 million RMB (approximately $3.5 million) in August 2014 as final payment from Sanofi. The terms of the settlement resulted in the recognition of promotion services revenue, for the second quarter of 2014, of approximately $0.2 million of Sanofi revenue that had been deferred in the fourth quarter of 2013. The remaining approximately $2.6 million of deferred revenue that had been deferred in the fourth quarter of 2013 was reversed with an equivalent write-down of accounts receivable. This contemporaneous write-down of accounts receivable and deferred revenue had no impact on net income for the second quarter of 2014 or for the year ended December 31, 2014. Our revenues for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with Sanofi were $0,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.2 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$25.0 million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our Baxter promotion agreement is for a 5-year term, through December 2017. Our Pfizer product distribution agreement is for a 5-year term, through June 2019. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	August 2015, we and Cardiome, from whom we licensed Aggrastat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:115%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	mutually agreed to end our collaboration for Aggrastat, and return all rights to the product to Cardiome. We recorded Aggrastat revenues of $1.8 million, $1.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and $0 million for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively, and we do not expect to generate any further Aggrastat revenues. We do not anticipate that the termination of this agreement will adversely affect our profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We continue to assess the financial performance of the products we promote and distribute under our agreements and their overall value within our entire portfolio of products. Over time, we anticipate the product mix that we promote will change, which may affect our revenues and profitability in the future. If any of these agreements are determined to no longer be beneficial to us and are allowed to expire, or if third parties will not renegotiate, renew or extend the agreements on terms acceptable to us, our revenues would be adversely affected and our profitability may be adversely or beneficially affected. On the other hand, if we are successful in negotiating better terms, there may be a positive impact on our revenues and profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>

	million

	,

</FONT>

	, or

	96

	he years ended December 31, 2015, 2014, and 2013

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

	Cost of product sales was $22.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to $23.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a decrease of $0.7 million. The decrease in cost of sales of $0.7 million, or 3%, for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to 2014 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	attributable to a $2.9 million decrease in cost of product sales of Aggrastat as we had recorded a provision of $2.1 million for excess Aggrastat inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2014 that didn&#x2019;t recur for the year ended December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. It was also attributable to our receipt in the fourth quarter of 2015 of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.1 million for reimbursement for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Aggrastat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inventory returned that we had previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fully
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	written off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which was recorded as a red
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	uction in cost of product sales. These decreases in cost of product sales were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	partially offset by increases in cost of product sales related to ZADAXIN and certain oncology product sales due to increased volume sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ost of product sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	also increased related to initial DC Bead sales in the second half of 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in cost of sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.3 million, or 30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for the year ended December 3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1, 2014, compared to 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was attributable to a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.0 million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in ZADAXIN cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of product sales related primarily to an in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in ZADAXIN un
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	it sales and a $3.3 million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in Aggrastat and oncology cost of sales as a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	higher
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sales volume of Aggrastat and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	certain oncology
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	product
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Cost of sales for Aggrastat product also increased for the year ended December 31, 2014 related to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provision of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for excess Aggrastat inventory expected to expire and $0.2 million associated with Aggrastat inventory shipped within six months of expiration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ZADAXIN cost of sales were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$18.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	17.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $15.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross margin for ZADAXIN was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	87.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	86.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 83.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s ended December 31, 2014 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The increase in gross margin for ZADAXIN for the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, was due primarily to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	higher production volume lowering per unit overhead costs and manufacturing efficiencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We expect our ZADAXIN cost of product sales and gross margins to fluctuate from period to period depending on the level of sales and price of our products, the absorption of product-related fixed costs, currency exchange fluctuations, any charges associated with excess or expiring finished product inventory, and the timing of other inventory period costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	such as manufacturing process improvements for the goal of future cost reductions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Overall, we expect our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	gross margin pe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	rcentages in 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	be lower than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on lower selling prices as set by one province, with indications of others to follow, as well as the unfavorable impact of currency exchange fluctuations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	:

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	S&amp;M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$54.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$48.5 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$55.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	S&amp;M expenses increased by $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to 2014, related to growth in our S&amp;M efforts for ZADAXIN and DC Bead. S&amp;M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expen
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ses decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by $6.8 million, or 12%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, compared to 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to the expiration of the Sanofi distribution agreements and the reduction in costs associated with marketing the products under the Sanofi agreements. The reductions in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	S&amp;M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended December 31, 2014, compared to 2013, were partially offset by increases in our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	S&amp;M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	efforts for ZADAXIN in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$12.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	14.6 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$8.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014 and 2013, we recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$11.0 million and $5.0 million, respectively, in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses related to upfront
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and milestone
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	costs under our in-license arrangements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, during the year ended December 31, 2015, R&amp;D expenditures included R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenditures related to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in-licensing agreements with certain business partners and R&amp;D activities in China. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, R&amp;D expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	included costs incurred related to preparation for a potential sepsis clinical study for ZADAXIN we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	contemplating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which has not been continued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The major components of R&amp;D expenses include salaries and other personnel-related expenses, including associated stock-based compensation, facility-related expenses, depreciation of facilities and equipment, license-related fees, services performed by clinical research organizations and research institutions and other outside service providers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	We anticipate our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses to increase in 2016 compared
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to potential license fee payments, milestone payments expected to occur under license arrangements, and related to research
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and development activities in China.
</FONT>
</P>

	million,

	and

	2015,

	2014,

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 2013
</FONT>
