	, higher professional consulting fees for b

	usiness development strategy,

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	ceivable

	customer

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the accounts receivable balance may not be recoverable. Additional increases in

	G&amp;A

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and our ongoing improvements to our FCPA compliance efforts, and approximately $1.1 million mainly related to accounting matters associated with the restatement of our consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2011 and certain quarters of 2012 and 2011 and matters involving consultation with the Securities and Exchange Commission related to one aspect of our accounting for one of our contracts, as well as higher general and administrative personnel-related costs and higher legal costs related to other general corporate matters.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage47"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We expect our G&amp;A expenses in 2016 to increase compared to 2015 related to growth in our business. As previously disclosed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in our Form 8-K issued in early February 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our Board is evaluating a range of strategic transactions with a view to enhancing shareholder value. We may incur certain G&amp;A expenses in connection with this evaluation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Restructuring Charges:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For the year ended December 31, 2013, we recorded $1.2 million to restructuring charges to reflect planned reductions in our China segment related to our sales force and the one-time termination benefits for approximately 175 employees as a result of the non-renewal of the Sanofi promotion agreement as of December 31, 2013.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The amounts provided were paid in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	SEC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Settlement Expense:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recorded a charge of $2.0 million in the fourth quarter of 2013 related to the possibility of a settlement with the SEC and DOJ regarding their investigation into possible violations of the FCPA by us, and we recorded additional charges totaling $10.8 million associated with the SEC settlement in 2015. In February 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we entered into a settlement agreement with the SEC fully resolving the SEC&#x2019;s investigation into possible violations of the FCPA. Under the terms of the settlement agreement, in February 2016 we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$12.8 million, including disgorgement, pre-judgement interest and a penalty as final settlement. As part of the agreement, we neither admitted nor denied engagement in any wrongdoing a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nd we agreed to give status reports to the SEC for the next three years on our continued remediation and implementation of anti-corruption compliance measures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The DOJ has also completed its related investigation and has declined to pursue any actions.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Refer to Part I, Item 3 &#x201C;Legal Proceedings&#x201D; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Part II, Item 8, Note 18 &#x201C;Contingencies&#x201D; and Note 22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Subsequent Events
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D; for further information on this matter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other Income:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On July 8, 2013, we and the representatives of the former stockholders of NovaMed entered into a &#x201C;Confidential Escrow Settlement Agreement&#x201D; pursuant to which we retained approximately $0.8 million in cash and 342,300 shares of our common stock, having a combined fair value of approximately $2.6 million on the settlement date. As a result, we recorded $2.6 million in the year ended December 31, 2013 to other inc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ome related to this settlement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Provision for Income Tax:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The provision
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for income tax relates to our foreign operations in China. The provision for income tax was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, $1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $2.2 million for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Tax expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decreased $0.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mainly related to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a reduction in our liabilities for uncertain tax positions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(and associated accrued interest)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in China due to certain tax years becoming closed to assessment due to the statute of limitations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The tax provision decreased $1.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to the year ended December 31, 2013, principally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	due to a reduction of approximately $0.2 million in our liabilities for uncertain tax positions (and associated accrued interest) due to certain tax years becoming closed to assessment due to the statute of limitations. Tax expense was also lower for the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to 2013, as a result of lower taxable income related to our China operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The statutory t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ax rate in China was 25% in 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We expect the provision for income tax to increase for t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he year ending December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	due to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	growth in our China operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we had net operating loss carryforwards for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	US
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	federal income tax purposes of approximately $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	114.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million that expire in the years 2020 through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and had approximately $52 million in net operating loss carryforwards related to our NovaMed Shanghai subsidiary that expire in the years 2016-2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. As of December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	US
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	federal research and development, orphan drug and investment tax credit carryforwards of approximately $12.2 million that expire in the years 2018 through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Because of the &#x201C;change in ownership&#x201D; provisions of the Internal Revenue Code, a portion of our net operating loss carryforwards and tax credit carryforwards may be subject to an annual limitation regarding their utilization against taxable income in future periods. As a result of the annual limitation, a portion of these carryforwards may expire before ultimately becoming available to reduce future income tax liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We continue to closely manage our liquidity and capital resources. We rely on our operating cash flows,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to provide for our liquidity requirements. We believe that we have the ability to meet our liquidity needs for at least the next 12 months to fund our working capital requirements of our operations, includi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ng investments in our business,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and to fund our business development activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, we had $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	101.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, in addition to the $12.8 million of restricted cash held in escrow for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SEC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	settlement,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of which $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	98.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million was located in subsidiaries of the Company outside the US. Cash and cash equivalents held by subsidiaries outside the US are held primarily in US dollars. Such cash and cash equivalents are used to fund the operating activities of our foreign subsidiaries and for further investment in foreign operations, which may include in-licensing new products, particularly for China, and for potential acquisitions. In the fourth quarter of 2015, we repatriated $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in funds via a special dividend distribution from our foreign subsidiary as a result of the need to fund an escrow facility for our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SEC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	settlement (as previously described). This dividend distribution was made from the current year earnings and pro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fits of our foreign subsidiary, which was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	not part of the cumulative pool of undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries as of December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have determined that as of December 31, 2015, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	176.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of accumulated undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries, after the payment of the dividend which was satisfied entirely out of current year earnings and profits, continues to be indefinitely reinvested outside of the US.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In making this determination, the following attributes were considered: (i) the expected future needs of the foreign subsidiaries, including working capital, capital expenditures, as well as additional investments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to support the infrastructure in our China subsidiaries
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(ii) additional investments to support our expansion in the China market as well as planned product licensing transactions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Upon distribution of our foreign undistributed earnings, we may be subject to US federal and state income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	taxes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Based on our current operating plan, we do not anticipate the need to repatriate undistributed earnings of cash and cash equivalents held by foreign subsidiaries accumulated as of December 31, 2015, but we do anticipate a need to repatriate a portion of future foreign earnings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to fund our US operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. We will accrue for US income taxes on future foreign earnings that we anticipate repatriating from our foreign subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	receivable totaling approximately $0.9 million from a single customer, which

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounts receivable increased $3.3 million mainly related to an increase in ZADAXIN sales. Inventory decreased $5.9 million mainly related to ZADAXIN inventory sales during the first half of 2014 exceeding our purchase levels, excluding approximately $2.9 million in Pfizer and Aggrastat inventory not yet paid for as of December 31, 2014. Accounts payable and accrued liabilities decreased $5.9 million mainly related to sales and marketing and manufacturing expense payments made during the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>

	ory of ZADAXIN in the channel.

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In December 2013, our subsidiary, NovaMed Shanghai, entered into a 10.0 million RMB revolving line of credit facility (approximately $1.6 million USD) and a maximum 15.0 million RMB loan facility (approximately $2.4 million USD) secured by its accounts receivable with Shanghai Pudong Development Bank Co. Ltd. (the &#x201C;Credit Facility&#x201D;). In June 2014, NovaMed Shanghai repaid the 10.0 million RMB (approximately $1.6 million USD) under the Credit Facility. The Credit Facility expired on November 30, 2014 and all amounts borrowed were repaid by the expiration date.

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As we are not able to reasonably estimate the timing of the payments or the amount by which our obligations for unrecognized tax benefits will increase or decrease over time, the related balances have not been reflected in the &#x201D;Payments Due by Period&#x201D; section of the table.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Under our $80.5 million stock repurchase program, we repurchased and retired 1,526,306 shares at a cost of $12.8 million during the year ended December 31, 2015 bringing the total repurchases since the program&#x2019;s inception to approximately 13.2 million shares at a cost of $78.1 million through December 31, 2015. Our stock repurchase program expired Decem
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ber 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is currently under strategic review by the Board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We recorded a charge of $2.0 million in the fourth quarter of 2013 related to the possibility of a settlement with the SEC and DOJ regarding their investigation into possible violations of the FCPA by us. Based on our discussions with the SEC, we recorded an additional $10.8 million in SEC settlement to operating expense for the year ended December 31, 2015, bringing the total loss to the government in penalties, fines and/or other remedies to $12.8 million. In February 2016, we entered into a settlement agreement with the SEC fully resolving the SEC&#x2019;s investigation into possible violations of the FCPA. Under the terms of the agreement, in February 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we paid $12.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8 million including disgorgement, pre-judgement interest and a penalty from our restricted escrow account that we funded in the fourth quarter of 2015. As part of the agreement, we neither admitted nor denied engagement in any wrongdoing and we agreed to give status reports to the SEC for the next three years on our continued remediation and implementation of anti-corruption compliance measures. The DOJ has also completed its related investigation and has declined to pursue any action. Refer to Part I, Item 3 &#x201C;Legal Proceedings&#x201D; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Part II, Item 8, Notes 18 and 22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for further information on this matter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Under our license agreements with third parties we have agreed to various milestone payments related to regulatory and commercial success and other achievements that may require substantial payments in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe that our existing cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	cash equivalents and ongoing revenue generating business operations will be sufficient to support our current operating plan for at least the next 12 months.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have no current commitments to offer and sell any securities that may be offered or sold pursuant to a registration statement. To the extent that we raise additional capital by issuing equity securities, our stockholders may experience dilution. Debt financing, if available, may subject us to restrictive covenants and significant interest costs. To the extent that we raise additional funds through collaboration and licensing arrangements, we would be required to relinquish some rights to our technologies, product candidates or marketing territories. Additional financing or collaboration and licensing arrangements may not be available when needed either at all or on favorable terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We intend to continue to explore alternatives for financing to provide additional flexibility in managing our operations, in-licensing new products, particularly for China, and potential acquisitions, as may be required.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition, as previously disclosed, our Board is evaluating a range of strategic transactions with a view to enhancing stockholder value.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	unavailability or the inopportune timing of any financing could prevent or delay our long-term product development and commercialization programs, either of which could hurt our business. We cannot assure you that funds from financings, if any, will be sufficient to in-license additional products. The need, timing and amount of any such financing would depend upon numerous factors, including the status of the pending regulatory investigations and pending litigations, the level and price of our products, the timing and amount of manufacturing costs related to our products, the availability of complementary products, technologies and businesses, the initiation and continuation of preclinical and clinical trials and testing, the timing of regulatory approvals, developments in relationships with existing or future
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	50
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	collaborative parties, the status of competitive products, and various alternatives for financing. We have not determined the timing or structure of any transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We do not have any off-sh
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eet balance sheet arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Significant Judgments and Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have identified the policies below as critical to our business operations and the understanding of our results of operations. The impact and any associated risks related to these policies on our business operations are discussed throughout &#x201C;Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#x201D; where such policies affect our reported and expected financial results. For a detailed discussion on the application of these and other accounting policies, see Note 1 in the &#x201C;Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements&#x201D; in Part II, Item&nbsp;8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K. Our consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ates, which require us to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amount of assets and liabilities, disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of our financial statements, and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. On an on-going basis, we evaluate the relevance of our estimates and judgments. We base our estimates on historical experience and on various other market-specific assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. There can be no assurance that actual results will not differ from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, services have been rendered or delivery has occurred, the price to the buyer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Product Revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recognize product revenue from selling manufactured ZADAXIN product at the time of delivery. Sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of ZADAXIN to Sinopharm are recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	upon the arrival of a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to its destination
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	when title
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and risk of loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the product
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	transferred to them. We also earn product revenue from purchasing medical products from pharmaceutical companies and selling them directly to importers or distributors. We recognize revenue related to these products based on the &#x201C;sell-in&#x201D; method, when the medical products have been delivered to the importers or distributors. Payments by the importing agents and distributors are not contingent upon sale to the end user by the importing agents or distributors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Promotion Services Revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recognize promotion services revenue after designated medical products are delivered to the distributors as specified in the promotion services contract
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which marks the period when marketing and promotion services have been rendered, and the revenue recognition criteria are met. In certain arrangements, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	required to return or refund a portion of promotion services fees received during interim periods from pharmaceutical customers if defined annual sales targets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	not achieved. Under our agreements with these customers, if the agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	terminated, and provided such targets ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	been met on a &#x201C;pro rata&#x201D; basis at the date of contract termination, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	entitled to retain the amounts paid. Due to these contractual provisions, we recognize
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenue during interim periods without reduction for amounts subject to refund based on Method 2 of Accounting Standards Codification 605-20-S99-1, &#x201C;Accounting for Management Fees Based on a Formula.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue Reserve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We maintain a revenue reserve for product returns based on estimates of the amount of product to be returned by our customers which is based on historical patterns, analysis of market demand and/or a percentage of sales based on industry trends, and management&#x2019;s evaluation of specific factors that may increase the risk of product returns. Importing agents or distributors do not have contractual rights of return except under limited terms regarding product quality. However, we are expected to replace products that have expired or are deemed to be damaged or defective when delivered. The calculation of the product returns reserve requires estimates and involves a high degree of subjectivity and judgment. As a result of the uncertainties involved in estimating the product returns reserve, there is a possibility that materially different amounts could be reported under different conditions or using different assumptions.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of Dec
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ember 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our revenue reserves were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	; the reserves were recorded as accrued liabilities on our consolidated balances sheets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We evaluate our returns reserve quarterly and adjust it when events indicate that a change in estimate is appropriate. Changes in estimates could materially affect our results of operations or financial position. It is possible that we may need to adjust our estimates in future periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounts Receivable Reserve
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We record a receivable reserve based on a specific r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eview of our overdue invoices.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our estimate for a reserve is determined after considering our existing contractual payment terms, payment patterns of our customers and individual customer circumstances, the age of any outstanding receivables and our current customer relationships. Accounts receivable are charged off at the point when they are considered uncollectible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, we had a receivable reserve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. In October
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014, our subsidiary,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SPIL China,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executed an agreement with a particular customer providing for settlement of a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million receivable balance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The terms of the settlement agreement resulted in the write-off of $1.1 million in previously fully reserved accounts receivable with an equivalent charge-off of the allowance for bad debt, which had no impact on net income in 2014, as the subsequent agreement provided direct evidence that the $1.1 million previously reserved will not be collected in the future. Of the remaining $1.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million receivable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	balance, $0.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and $1.0 million were collected in 2015 and 2014, respectively, per the terms of the settlement agreement, and these gains on recovery were recorded as reductions to general and administrative expense for the years ended December 31, 2015 a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, a balance of $0.5 million remained uncollected from the same customer but remained fully reserved. We recognized $0.5 million of bad debt expense in general and administrative expense during the first quarter of 2015 related to past due receivables from another customer, due to uncertainty regarding the collectability of the customer&#x2019;s outstanding receivable balance. We wrote-off the $0.5 million of past due accounts receivable from this customer during the fourth quarter of 2015 as uncollectible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our inventories are valued at the lower of cost or market (net realizable value), with cost determined on a first-in, first-out basis and include amounts related to materials, labor and overhead. In assessing the ultimate realization of inventories, we are required to make judgments as to future demand requirements and compare that with the current inventory levels. If our current assumptions about future production or inventory levels and demand were to change or if actual market conditions are less favorable than those projected by management, inventory write-downs may be required, which could negatively impact our gross margins and results of operations. If obsolete or excess
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	items
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are observed and there are no alternate uses for the inventory, we will record a write-down to net realizable value in the period that the impairment is first recognized.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we recorded inventory write-downs of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0, $2.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, $0, respectively, principally related to carrying value reductions for excess Aggrastat product.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As we have discontinued this product, remaining inventory is zero at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We account for goodwill in accordance with ASC Topic 805, and ASC Topic 350,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Intangibles&nbsp;&#x2014; Goodwill and Other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. ASC Topic 805 requires that the acquisition method of accounting be used for all business combinations and specifies the criteria that must be met in order for intangible assets acquired in a business combination to be recognized and reported apart from goodwill.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Goodwill is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	tested for impairment at least annually or whenever events or circumstances occur that indicate impairment might have occurred or circumstances suggest that the carrying value of these assets may not be recoverable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the undiscounted cash flows estimated to be generated by those assets are less than the carrying amounts of those assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in accordance with ASC Topic 350. Judgment regarding the existence of impairment indicators will be based on operating results, changes in the manner of our use of the acquired assets or our overall business strategy, and market and economic trends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.1PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	relates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to our China segment which focuses on our primary pharmaceutical distribution market, consisting of the NovaMed business and the legacy China business of the Company, which represent a single reporting unit. For t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we tested for goodwill impairment by quantitatively comparing the fair value of the reporting unit to its carrying amounts - step one of the two-step impairment test. We estimated the fair value of the China reporting unit using a discounted cash flow model. This valuation approach considers a number of factors that include, but are not limited to, expected future cash flows, growth rates, discount rates, and requires us to make certain assumptions and estimates regarding industry economic factors and future profitability of our business. Although we believe our assumptions are reasonable, actual results may vary significantly and may expose us to impairment charges in the future. Our methodology for determining fair value remained consistent for the periods presented. If we determine that the carrying value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reporting unit exceeds its fair value, we would then calculate
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	52
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.1PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the implied fair value of the reporting unit goodwill as compared to its carrying value to determine the appropriate impairment charge. After completing our annual impairment review for the reporting unit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and our interim impairment review during the third quarter of 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as a result of the notification by Sanofi of the non-renewal of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	promotional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with them at the end of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	their
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	on December 31, 2013, we concluded that g
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	oodwill was not impaired in 2015, 2014, or 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Loans Receivable
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Loans receivable consist of two loans to one third party (see Note 6). Loans are initially recorded, and continue to be carried, at unpaid principal balances under &#x201C;other assets&#x201D; on the consolidated balance sheet as of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014. Carried balances are subsequently adjusted for payments of principal or adjustments to the allowance for loan losses to account for any impairment. Interest income is recognized over the term of the loans and is calculated using the simple-interest method, as the loans do not have associated premium or discount. If the loans were to experience impairment, interest income would not be recognized unless the likelihood of further loss was remote.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management considers impairment to exist when, based on current information or factors (such as payment history, value of collateral, and assessment of the counterparty&#x2019;s current creditworthiness), it is probable that principal and interest payments will not be collected according to the contractual agreements. Management considers a loan payment delinquent when not received by the due date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management assessed the credit worthiness of the counterparty by reviewing available borrower financial information and substantiation of the value of the pledged security interest in the course of preparing our consolidated financial statements. Management also considered in its analysis that the borrower was compliant with the terms of the loans, that interest payments have been time
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ly made
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and that available reliable evidence indicated that the market value of the pledged security was greater than the loan receivable balance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. As of December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, management concluded the loans receivable were not impaired, and there was no allowance for loan losses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Contingent Liabilities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We record as liabilities estimated amounts for litigation, claims or other legal actions that are probable and can be reasonably estimated. The likelihood of a material change in these estimated reserves is dependent on the possible outcome of settlement negotiations, regulatory or judicial review and the development of facts and circumstances in extended litigation, which could change claims or assessments when both the amount and range of loss on some outstanding litigation is uncertain. We disclose in the footnotes of the financial statements when we are unable to make a reasonable estimate of a material liability that could result from unfavorable outcomes. As events occur, we will assess the potential liability related to any pending litigation, claims or other legal actions and adjust our estimates accordingly.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We record stock-based compensation costs relating to share-based payment transactions, including stock options, restricted stock units (&#x201C;RSUs&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, performance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	restricted stock units (&#x201C;PSUs&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and employee stock purchase plans
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;ESPP&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Stock-based compensation expense for stock options and the employee stock purchase plan is estimated at the date of grant based on the fair value of the award using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. Stock-based compensation expense for RSUs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and PSUs is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	estimated at the date of grant based on the number of shares granted and the quoted price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock on the grant date.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock-based compensation expense values
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for stock options, RSUs and the ESPP plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	are recognized as expense on a straight-line basis over the requisite service period, net of estimated forfeitures.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We recognize expense related to the performance stock options and PSUs over the implicit service period if it is probable that the performance goals will be achieved. If it is subsequently determined that the performance goals are not probable of achievement, the expense related to the performance stock options or PSUs is reversed.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	hare
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-based
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	payment awards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that are ultimately expected to vest are recognized as expense ratably (as the awards vest) over the requisite service period, which is generally one or four years for stock options and RSUs and three months for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ESPP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We estimate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pre-vesting forfeitures at the time of grant by analy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	zing historical data and revise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	those estimates in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from those estimates. The total expense recognized over the vesting period will only be for those awards that ultimately vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The option-pricing models require the use of certain subjective assumptions, including the expected volatility of the market price of the underlying stock and the expected term of the award. Expected volatility is based on the historical volatility of our stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	53
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Expected term is derived from historical data on employee exercises and terminations. We review our valuation assumptions at each grant date, and, as a result, valuation assumptions used to value stock-based compensation of awards granted in future periods may change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Income taxes are accounted for under the liability method. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the difference between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities as measured by the enacted tax rates that will be in effect when these differences reverse. We provide a valuation allowance against deferred tax assets if, based upon the available evidence, it is more-likely-than-not that the deferred tax assets will not be realized. Realization of our deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income, the timing and amount of which are uncertain. The tax years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1995-2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	remain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	open to examination by the major
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	US
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	taxing jurisdictions to which we are subject. The Internal Revenue Service completed their examination
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2008, 2009 and 2011
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	US Federal tax returns with no additional tax assessments or proposed adjustments relating to taxable income for any years.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our China income tax returns are generally subject to examination for a period of five years and those years remain open to examination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We record liabilities related to uncertain tax positions in accordance with the guidance that clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#x2019;s financial statements by prescribing a minimum recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. We do not believe any such uncertain tax positions currently pending will have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial statements, although an adverse resolution of one or more of these uncertain tax positions in any period could have a material impact on the results of operations for that period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Restructuring Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	When necessary, we record
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expense for the estimated costs of restructuring activities. The liability recorded for restructuring costs contains uncertainties because management is required to make assumptions and to apply judgment to estimate the amounts and timing of future settlement payments and the timing of such payments. When making these assumptions, management considers a number of factors including the number of employees involved and the related benefits included in the restructuring plan, and historical settlement experience. We do not believe there is a reasonable likelihood that there will be a material change in the estimates or assumptions we use to calculate our restructuring liabilit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. However, if actual results are not consistent with our estimates or assumptions, we may be exposed to losses or gains which would have an impact on the results of operations for that period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	New Accounting Standard
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Updates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;ASU&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Revenue from Contracts with Customers"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;ASU 2014-09&#x201D;), which contains new accounting literature relating to how and when a company recognizes revenue. Under ASU 2014-09, a company will recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the company expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods and services. ASU 2014-09 is effective for our fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018, which reflects a one year deferral approved by the FASB in July 2015, with early application permitted provided that the effective date is not earlier than the original effective date. We are in the process of determining what impact, if any, the adoption of ASU 2014-09 will have on our financial statements and related disclosures. The standard permits the use of either the full retrospective or modified retrospective transition method. We have not yet selected a transition method nor have we determined the effect of the standard on our ongoing financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In July 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-11, "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Inventory (Topic 330): Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	" (&#x201C;ASU 2015-11&#x201D;) which applies to inventory that is measured using first-in, first-out ("FIFO") or average cost. Under the updated guidance, an entity should measure inventory that is within scope at the lower of cost and net realizable value, which is the estimated selling prices in the ordinary course of business, less reasonably predictable costs of completion, disposal and transportation. Subsequent measurement is unchanged for inventory that is measured using last-in, first-out ("LIFO"). This ASU is effective for annual and interim periods beginning after December 15, 2016, and should be applied prospectively with early adoption permitted at the beginning of an interim or annual reporting period. We have evaluated the impact of adopting this guidance and have concluded we will likely have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	effect on the financial statements as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our adjustments already reflect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the concept of net realizable value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	nventory provisions are generally full write-downs for the affected inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	54
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	In November
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-17, "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes."
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	This ASU amends existing guidance to require that deferred income tax liabilities and assets be classified as noncurrent in a classified balance sheet, and eliminates the prior guidance which required an entity to separate deferred tax liabilities and assets into a current amount and a noncurrent amount in a classified balance sheet. The amendments in this ASU are effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, and interim periods within those annual periods. Earlier application is permitted as of the beginning of an interim or annual period. Additionally, the new guidance may be applied either prospectively to all deferred tax liabilities and assets or retrospectively to all periods presented.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	We have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	not yet se
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	lected an adoption method
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	impact of adopting this guidance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	is not expected to be material to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	consolidated financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	given our deferred tax amounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In February 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	6, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02 &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&#x201D;. Under the new guidance, lessees will be required to recognize a lease liability and a lease asset for all leases, including operating leases, with a term greater than 12 months on its balance sheet. The update also expands the required quantitative and qualitative disclosures surrounding leases. This update is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2018 and interim periods within those fiscal years, with earlier application permitted. We are evaluating the impact of the adoption of this update on our consolidated financial statements and related disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 6PT 55.45PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.45PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;7A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 31PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<A NAME="SCLN-20151231X10K_HTM_QUANTITATIVE_QUALITATIVE">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We do not hold any derivative financial instruments for speculation or trading purposes. The majority of our sales have been in US dollars, although a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	portion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of our s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ales are denominated in RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Per our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	previous contractual arrangement with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through December 31, 2015, and a renewed contractual arrangement with Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our sole
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	importer and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	distributor for ZADAXIN in China
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) which took effect January 1, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sales of ZADAXIN to Sinopharm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	have been and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	continue to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	denominated in US dollars
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. However
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the established importer price ma
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	y be adjusted quarterly based upon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	exchange rate fluctuations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	between the US dollar and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recent months the RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	experienced devaluation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which has led to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and may continue to lead to,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	downward adjustments in our importer price if further devaluation continues. While our revenue may be negatively affected, our expenses are also positively impacted as a substantial portion of our expenses are denominated in RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our purchases with contract manufacturers are denominated in US dollars and euros and costs of our marketing efforts in China are paid in local currency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, we have certain cash balances and other assets and liabilitie
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s denominated in euros, RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and Hong Kong dollars. As a result, we are exposed to foreign currency rate fluctuations, and we do not hedge against the risk associated with such fluctuations. Consequently, changes in exchange rates could result in material exchange losses and could unpredictably, materially and adversely affect our operating results and stock price. A hypothetical 1% increase or decrease in foreign exchange rates would result in an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximate $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increase or decrease in our financial assets and liabilitie
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s denominated in euros, RMB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and Hong Kong
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	dollars, as of December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These potential changes are based on sensitivity analyses performed on our financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	position as of December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Actual results may differ materially.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest Rate Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT:21.6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The primary objective of our investment activities is to preserve principal while at the same time maximizing yields without significantly increasing risk. To achieve this objective, we invest in money market funds, term deposits, commercial paper, corporate bonds, US treasury, or government agency notes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	; our investments are most frequently classified as cash equivalents. We are also invested in a loan to a business partner; however, the purpose for such loan is to facilitate the business relationship and it is not principally for investment purposes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Our investment securities may be subject to interest rate risk and could decrease in value if market interest rates rise. To minimize this risk, we primarily hold securities that are short-term in duration and maintain an average maturity of less than one year. We believe that our exposure to interest rate risk is not significant and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a 1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	movement in market interest rates would not have a significant impact to the total value of our investment p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rtfolio as of December 31, 2015 or 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.1PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-INDENT: -55.1PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;8.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 34PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<A NAME="SCLN-20151231X10K_HTM_FINANCIAL_STMTS_SUPPLEMENTARY">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Financial Statements and Supplementary Data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	SCICLONE PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	INDEX TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 85.82%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.08%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:86.16%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.08%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:03.96%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
